author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: Watch Amari Cooper run through Chargers defense for 52-yard touchdown
text:
Watch Amari Cooper run through Chargers defense for 52-yard touchdown Amari Cooper Oakland Raiders wide receiver Amari Cooper changes direction on a 52-yard touchdown play during the first half of an NFL game against the San Diego Chargers on Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015, in San Diego. (AP Photo) Comments 
Oakland Raiders wide receiver Amari Cooper took a tour of the San Diego Chargers defense and ended up in the end zone during an NFL game on Sunday afternoon. 
In the second quarter in San Diego, Cooper took a step back from the line of scrimmage and caught a swing pass from quarterback Derek Carr. On his way down the field, Cooper put on a couple of ankle-breaking cuts that allowed him run down the middle of the field without a San Diego defender laying a hand on him. AMARI COOPER GODLVL pic.twitter.com/PEeN8o7hdT â€” Brothel Westbrook (@BillionBus) October 25, 2015 
Cooper joined the Raiders as the fourth player selected in the 2015 NFL Draft on April 30. The former Alabama standout entered the game with 28 receptions for 386 yards and two touchdowns in his first five NFL games. 
FOR MORE OF AL.COM'S COMPREHENSIVE COVERAGE OF THE NFL, GO TO OUR NFL PAGE 
Cooper had two 100-yard receiving games in his short NFL career and already had reached that standard again in the first half against the Chargers. He also had a 44-yard catch against San Diego in the first half.
